About Donorbox
Donorbox is a leading fundraising platform and donor management system for nonprofit organizations. Our mission is to accelerate positive impact worldwide by helping nonprofits become highly effective at raising funds and managing their supporter base. Since 2014, we have powered more than 100,000 global organizations to close to $3B in donations. ðŸš€

Our fast-growing company is profitable and bootstrapped with a healthy run rate. We have a fully distributed and diverse 150-person team based in 16+ states and 23+ countries.

ðŸ…Donorbox is rated the #1 software for fundraising, donor management, and nonprofit payment on G2 based on hundreds of verified customer reviews. We're proud of what we do, and our product reflects it!
The Role
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Data Team. This role is pivotal in guiding technical decisions, enabling product development, and supporting customer-facing teams by leveraging data insights to drive business strategy.

As an individual contributor within our Data Team, you will be responsible for gathering, cleaning, aggregating, and cross-referencing data from multiple sources, including our PaaS product and various company tools. Your insights will help us understand user behavior, optimize workflows, and measure the effectiveness of our solutions.
Who You Are
You are a meticulous statistical analysis professional (almost pedantic) who loves uncovering hidden insights in vast data sets. You thrive on cleaning up messy metrics and refining dashboards while singing â€œCorrelation doesn't imply causationâ€. You have a keen eye for spotting metrics that can be tricky or overly simplistic, and you consistently double-check their accuracy and relevance.
Responsibilities

1. Cross-functional Collaboration
Act as a translator between data and business objectives, describing and connecting product metrics to company's OKRs and KPIs.
Work closely with product, business, and engineering teams to gather requirements and define key metrics for success.
Request and define new measurements from other teams, providing clear explanations and connections to the company OKRs.

2. Metrics Analysis & Strategy:
Develop and monitor strategic KPIs that align with organizational OKRs, ensuring they are actionable and results-oriented.
Analyze platform performance data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.
Define measurements, metrics, and tools for measuring the products.

3. Dashboard Development & Reporting:
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards for tracking KPIs and key data points.
Provide regular insights and reports to stakeholders, enabling informed, data-driven decision-making

4. Process Optimization:
Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in metric tracking and reporting processes, proposing innovative solutions to enhance accuracy
Ensure data integrity and accuracy across all reporting tools and systems.

5. Strategic Input:
Partner with leadership to align product analytics with broader business goals and OKRs.
Contribute to defining and refining the long-term data strategy of the company.
Qualifications & Experience
7+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a similar field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Expert-level knowledge of statistics- you never mistake correlation for causation. Even if you try ;)
Self-motivated team player, able to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, adapting to evolving team needs.
Ability to translate data into actionable insights and present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Customer-oriented approach with a focus on providing excellent service.
Very comfortable with SQL.
Excellent pragmatism in analyzing metrics, with the ability to distinguish between valuable, actionable metric and mere trivia.
Details
Fully remote based in Latin America
Salary: $45k-$60k USD per annum, depending on experience and location
Benefits & Perks
Fully remote work from the comfort of your home
Eligibility for employee equity plan (stock options)
Reimbursement package for home office expenses, up to $1.5k
Health insurance premium reimbursements, up to 75% for you and your family
Generous time off policy of 21 days (birthday included ðŸŽ‰), 8 holidays of your choice, and 2 paid volunteer days
Wellness program with fitness and mindfulness classes

Role title: Data Analyst

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way youâ€™d like, where youâ€™ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where youâ€™ll be able to reimagine whatâ€™s possible. Location: Argentina

Role description


Data Analyst is responsible for detecting and preventing automated abuse of client's website including:

Scraping of content (jobs, resumes) that exposes Client data to malicious actors
Automated actions (applying to jobs, posting/reporting of company reviews) that distort our employment marketplace with high-volume actions
Extracting free value (i.e. unlimited resume views within free trial) from Indeed that risks jobseeker data getting into the wrong hands.

The team is focused on rapid experimentation and marketplace changes using a number of anti-bot tactics, and measuring success and opportunity sizes for various efforts is critical. We are presently lacking the staffing to scale this process up, leading to bottlenecks that delay our ability to react to new threats or properly measure the impact of our mitigation efforts.


Typical duties will include:

Developing new business metrics to help quantify the scale of bot usage on various Indeed products
Measuring the impact of anti-bot strategies
Creating dashboards and reporting that capture the teamâ€™s progress
Presenting results and learnings to leadership audiences



Required Skills:

5+ years experience using SQL and Python to analyze data for business problems
Familiarity working with large data sets (> 1 billion records) using tools like Spark, Presto, Athena
Strong communication and presentation skills and the ability to tell a story with data
